articles.description: Health Minister Robin Swann has announced Belfast's Nightingale Hospital will be "stood down" as the coronavirus crisis in Northern Ireland eases.
articles.content:
Health Minister Robin Swann has announced Belfast's Nightingale Hospital will be "stood down" as the coronavirus crisis in Northern Ireland eases. 
He said the Department of Health had made the decision to reduce the escalation level for critical care to low… [+1504 chars]

articles.title: 24 health staff at Antrim Area Hospital test positive for coronavirus - Belfast Telegraph
articles.description: An outbreak of coronavirus has affected more than 20 staff at a local hospital over the past six weeks.
articles.content:
An outbreak of coronavirus has affected more than 20 staff at a local hospital over the past six weeks. 
A total of 24 health workers have tested positive for the virus on two wards of Antrim Area Hospital since April 1. Twelve of those cases have occurred i… [+2622 chars]

articles.title: 'Covid-fighting' drug is imperilled by politics - The Conservative Woman
articles.description: ‘Covid-fighting’ drug is imperilled by politics
articles.content:
THE question of the effectiveness of the anti-malarial drug hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) in treating Covid-19 remains contested. 
There is a great deal of anecdotal evidence (and a number of studies) suggesting that, when used early, the treatment can help save … [+4098 chars]

articles.title: Live updates: Firms who breach social distancing guidelines could be prosecuted with 44% of employees working from home - Sunderland Echo
articles.description: It’s Wednesday, May 13 and we will be bringing you all the latest updates from the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.
articles.content:
Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak have revealed that the UK will very likely face a recession caused by the coronavirus outbreak.
In an interview, Mr Sunak said: It is now very likely that the UK economy will face a significant recession this year.
